intro: Ischnocarpus novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Ischnocarpus novae-zelandiae is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
